instruction: Can the proposed soft sensor modeling approach using nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectral data be considered superior to traditional methods for evaluating the fraction yield of crude oil?
Output: Yes, the proposed soft sensor modeling approach using nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectral data can be considered superior to traditional methods for evaluating the fraction yield of crude oil. The traditional method of properties evaluation in the laboratory is time-consuming, while the near-infrared spectrum technology has limitations in terms of accuracy and application conditions. In contrast, the use of NMR allows for more accurate and efficient evaluation of crude oil properties. The ensemble deep learning based soft sensor modeling approach presented in the paper effectively learns the features of the 1H NMR spectral data and improves the accuracy of fraction yield evaluation.
